intro: Cicerbita floridana, commonly known as the Florida bitterroot, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. The plant's name refers to its bitter taste and its native range in Florida.
